instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.I2C_BKLT: What is I2C_BKLT? I2C_BKLT is a data line between the LCD screen and the LED driver. This data line cannot short to ground. If it does, the screen cannot talk to the LED driver, and the LED driver will not allow the circuit to produce a backlight..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message:
[SIZE=14px][U][B]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight.[/B][/U][/SIZE]


[B]History:[/B]
Liquid damage, Backlight circuit repaired.

[B]Machine is powering:[/B]
Machine chimes.
CPU gets hot.
External monitor works but cuts on and off... some sort of detection issue presumed...?
Tested with know working LCD eDP screen with joy = 0

[B][U]eDP Pins voltages[/U][/B]

[B]Backlight circuit working:[/B]
Pin 1 = 49V
Pin 3 & 4 <SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT</SIGNAL> = Data both pins
Pin 5 - 3v3
Pin 8 = PWM

Any suggestions on what I should be checking instead?

[B]EDIT:[/B] Pin 30, 29, 28 = 5V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message: 49v means it isn't seeing the screen. either a break inside the LCD connector, 49v is not making its way to the LCD connector, break in the cable, or the screen itself is fucked. Whenever backlight voltage is too high, it means it does not detect a load, and 49v is way too high for this machine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message: Mother F* I was using the wrong screen!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image no backlight
threads.message: :D been there done that... does it work now?
